hc.server.msb

Class Device

  • java.lang.Object
    • Processor
      • hc.server.msb.Device

  • public abstract class Device
extends Processor
    • In most cases, a real device provides one function.
      For example, a air condition provides temperature control function, if a air condition also provides lighting (equal a smart bulb), you should design two Device to provide each one of functions.
    • A Device may be a agent to a virtual service.
    • A Device is means not only a real device. After connect(), there are maybe two or more same model real devices managed by a instance of Device.
    • To drive Device, invoke Robot.dispatch(Message, boolean) or Robot.waitFor(Message, long)
    • The Message.getDevID() returns real device ID, if Message is received in Device or dispatched from Device.
    • The Message.getDevID() returns Reference Device ID (not real device ID), if the Message is received in Robot or dispatched from Robot.
    • After active and apply HAR project, Reference Device ID of Robot must refer to real device ID (a Robot can works well without any Device). If fail on auto-bind (Robot.getDeviceCompatibleDescription(String) for more), the binding dialog will be shown.
    • A real device ID may be referenced by more than one Reference Device ID.
      For example, a temperature device initiative publish current temperature to all robots by dispatch(Message, boolean), and the Message will be cloned (not deep).
    • Robot is the only way to drive Device, even if the Device is not in same HAR project.
      To access Robot instance from Mlet or CtrlResponse, please invoke ProjectContext.getRobot(String) and drive Device via Robot.operate(long, Object).
    • Message is an intermediary between Robot and Device (maybe Converter).
      Message is never used outside of Robot, Converter and Device. In other words, you can't get a instance of Message from Mlet or CtrlResponse.
    • Because the Device can communicate with the Robot which is not in the same HAR project. It may be a good practice to put only one Device in a HAR project. If the device need to be substituted or upgraded, what you should do is upgrade HAR project with the newer. Re-binding will not be executed in this case if real device ID is same. For more, see Converter.
    See Also:
    Robot

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public abstract String[] connect()
        connect to the real device(s). One or more real devices may be managed by this instance.

        this method is invoked by server before ProjectContext.EVENT_SYS_PROJ_STARTUP.

        if this device will initiative publish status, please put the task in ProjectContext.run(Runnable) and the task should be finished when disconnect().

        Warning : this method will block thread of HomeCenter server.

        About binding
        1. before binding, please turn on this/these same model real devices first.
        2. this method is invoked by server before binding, and it returns an array of IDs of real devices of this same model.
        3. user may be required to input token of device, see ProjectContext.showInputDialog(String, String[], String[]),
        4. to save the token of device, see ProjectContext.saveProperties().
        Returns:
        the string array of real devices ID of the same model of device.
        Since:
        7.0
        See Also:
        disconnect()

      • disconnect

        public abstract void disconnect()
        disconnect the real device(s).

        this method is invoked by server after ProjectContext.EVENT_SYS_PROJ_SHUTDOWN
        Since:
        7.0
        See Also:
        connect()

      • dispatch

        protected void dispatch(Message msg,
            boolean isInitiative)
        dispatch Message to robot(s).

        the msg can't be dispatched more than one time.

        to print log of creating/converting/transferring/recycling of message, please enable [Option/Developer/log MSB message].
        Parameters:
        msg - the Message will be dispatched to robot(s). To get instance of the msg, call getFreeMessage(String).
        isInitiative -
        if true, initiative to report status of Device to robot(s). If the device ID is binded to multiple robots, the msg will be cloned and dispatched to all these robots (NOT deep clone. copy keys of property/body and the corresponding values).
        if false, answer passively, passive mode is normally used in method response(Message), the msg will be dispatched ONLY to the request robot, even if the real device ID is binded to multiple Reference Device ID.
        Since:
        7.0
        See Also:
        Robot.dispatch(Message, boolean)

      • getFreeMessage

        protected Message getFreeMessage(String from_dev_id)
        get a free Message from recycling message pool.
        Parameters:
        from_dev_id - the real device ID that the message is dispatched from.
        The message may be converted by Converter or not depends on binding (after active current project).
        Returns:
        a free Message

      • reportStatus

        public void reportStatus(boolean isOK,
                int statusCode,
                String message)
        report status of this device to monitor of server (not to client).

        the message will be logged.

        this method is invoked when an error is raised or device is turned to OK from error.
        it is NOT required if there is no error on device.
        Parameters:
        isOK - true : device turn to OK from error; false : device turn to error from OK.
        statusCode - the error/status code, 0 means OK. if unknown, set it to -1.
        message - the description of status message, the project name and device name is not required.
        Since:
        7.0

      • response

        public abstract void response(Message msg)
        response a message from robot.

        the general procedure to response a Message passively is as following:
        1. Message newMsg = this.getFreeMessage(msg.getDevID());
        2. set header or body of newMsg
        3. dispatch(newMsg, false);//false is required, because it is passively.
        4. it is allowed to dispatch an initiative Message in this method.
        Parameters:
        msg - dispatched from Robot.dispatch(Message, boolean) or Robot.waitFor(Message, long) (it is also may be converted by a Converter)
        See Also:
        dispatch(Message, boolean)
